SpPWLlK_wsr55QyTmc_Axg.text: Well, after a visit to this well reviewed spot, there's no argument as to why I'd add a five star review to it's impressive pile! The style of this place is great (amazing copper piping light fixtures around the ceilings, beautiful pastry spread up front), the food was impressively good (taking standard breakfast classics and upping their game a bit), the coffee was good, and the garden oasis out back provides a night haven from the bustling city at it's doorstep. In fact I'm having a hard time convincing myself to get out and try somewhere new for breakky this morning. Thank you for rocking, Trade! (See you in ten minutes!)

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Blueberry pancakes and avo smash with chorizo. Get-into-mah-BELLEH!

bf7mSOqhwQ-1REza5Qwc5w.text: The word is out about this place--it was absolutely packed on a Sunday at 12pm.  So much so that the kitchen was backed up for 30 minutes which was announced to us when we queued up for a table.  Was it worth the wait?  Not so sure.  Brunch options were slightly limited (I really wanted a salad) and my grilled cheese came with no side.  Menu and service needs to be rethought, but the space is awesome.

C6B60WBFkBegtu8_apyn8g.text: It doesn't look like much from the front, was introduced to it by a friend. However inside and out the back it's a whole different story. Amazing brunch and nice seating area either inside or out with natural light. Very good and extensive brunch options with the ability to make substitutes. I would definitely recommend to everyone and come back. This is now my go to local brunch spot.

QAyRYBZ4NnjliUgk4Cj7gA.text: Used to be a regular a while ago and the place was fantastic with amazing staff. Came back today to check it out and it's gone a bit under in terms of service. Food is still great, but to wait almost 15 min for 2 coffees it is a bit absurd (place wasn't even that busy compared to before). Surely i'll comeback again and hopefully update my review :-)

ykRZ31Y_SMrlV2mQes1-Jg.text: Only stopped in for filter coffee - cool space and nice atmosphere.  Food looked great though didn't have any.  My complaint is that the filter coffee was 2.70, and it was a 6 or 8 oz cup.  Very good coffee, but that is, by a large margin, the most I've ever paid for coffee anywhere in the world.  It would have to be liquid gold to be priced like that.  So can't recommend it if you're just looking for a coffee shop.

OhV7cr9EeRqgqtNiGAqrLg.text: As always we have been greeted with a smile! Coffee and carrot cake were really good! Excellent place for a quick meal or a coffee!

NnLnS1y8hqv-aamIjvpD0Q.text: This place is like a hole in the wall in one of the not-so-well-developed areas off Whitechapel Road. It would be difficult to notice it if one were walking past. But the inside of the cafe tells a different story. The aroma that greets you once inside is very enticing. The decor is modern and minimalistic, with ample use of wooden benches which are crammed into every which corner of the smallish seating area. This does make life a bit difficult if you are here to spend some time. The food is great though and very american. The pastrami could have been better, but the pancakes were excellent. The latter could be improved by serving it with melted butter and more syrup! The menu is quite well thought out, and I would love to try out the rest of it in subsequent visits. Oh, and I liked the latte in the tumbler, it was a nice touch, and reminded me of how I used to drink tea/coffee back home in India.

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Pastrami Benedict
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. The not-so-easily-identifiable store-front ...
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. The Reuben (also note latte in tumbler in the background)

h-LiEe93MzTtJNNjOTL_wg.text: Brilliant coffee, sandwiches and brekkies. Independent shoppe run be Aussies - laid back service but great vibe and outdoor seating in nice weather!

Y2RA3jZUVm5Itvy51S-g8A.text: The wait was long to get a table even just for 1, which I expected going in after reading all the reviews. Wasn't upset or surprised and it was all too easy to order take away so I did. Got the Gruber and whoa! Being an avid fan of pastrami and being a New York loving American I knew what good pastrami was and by golly this place has damn good pastrami! Whaaaaaat! So delicious. I was immediately impressed even with a take away and walking at least 10 minutes until I unwrapped that goodness and was able to eat it. Still hot, so fresh, so flavorful, so so good. Every bite was better than the next. Highly highly recommend! The only bummer about the visit was when I tried to order a slice of their delicious looking cakes (banana mmm) I immediately got denied with a "sorry we aren't selling those anymore" without any further explaination. They just started walking off with plates of half gone cakes and pasteries and that was that. Too bad my friend had to miss out and get her dreams crushed. My coffee was also top notch. Loved this place and think everyone should go. Cheers.

efvQjkkUFiwvWyFU7bWSyA.text: The pictures speaks for themselves, the place is really nice and the really care about the food. The have really nice bread.The coffee is particularly good! I wouldnt hesitate a second to come back.

46NlWUuA2LpGPJgYyYUxoQ.text: This is a hidden gem in Shoreditch. Well, I say hidden, but it's just a little bit down the road from the more crowded Spitalfields market. I was looking for another restaurant at the time and I was attracted by the delicious-looking spread of food I could spy on the counter.I popped in to have a closer look at the sandwiches and study the menu. Even leaving aside the counter food, there are plenty of tempting lunch options.I had the slow cooked pork and apple slaw which came on a toasted brioche bun. Delicious. It looked too hard to pick up and eat like a burger, so I improvised. I was eating the bun with my left hand and using my fork to shovel the rest of it, in between bites.I am quite keen to go back soon and try some of the other things. I might go for the pancakes next time.

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Slow cooked pork and apple slaw on a toasted brioche bun.

BRHQja9157sbX5Zs8DT0LQ.text: Following Yelp led us to Trade for a brunch with our boy who lives just round the corner. Thanks Yelpers...what a great venue.  Coffee was spot on and brunch really hit the spot. The combination of scrambled eggs and smashed avocado was grand and the pastrami eggs benedict simply vanished off the boy's plate!It was busy. It was a tad noisy to have a mother-son catch-up conversation but it was top notch.Thanks Trade. Looking forward to our next visit.....

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Great selection of sweet treats.

StITKTPJa5XX_saJidHSeQ.text: Trade is my favourite breakfast spot. It's got practically everything you need in for a good lazy weekend breakfast. First up, the food. Trade offers up the usual kind of breakfast food you might find in other diners in the area such as pancakes and egg dishes and all that sorts of things, but what they also offer are incredible lobster rolls, smashed avocado on sourdough bread and delicious, delicious pastrami sandwiches, probably the best in London, according to those in the know. Next, the space. Trade is open and airy, and even has a secret garden, great for those all-too-rare warm London days. It's not too cramped, and there's a nice communal table at the back as well. The cafe offers free wifi and there's lemon-infused (depending on when it was last refilled) water as well. And, best of all, they have newspapers which anyone can read through. I don't know about you, but that's my key ingredient for a lazy breakfast.They also do photo exhibitions in here. The first time I went in, they had an exhibition featuring various curry chefs on Brick Lane. I really liked the East End communal spirit this invoked.Next, the drinks. I'm not a big fan of the coffee here as there are others in the area which do better flat whites, but, at the very least, it's tolerable. I tend to stick to tea when I am in here for that reason, but, that said, they have fresh mint tea, so that's all fine with me.Last, the staff. The staff have always been very friendly each time I've been in, and they have also been patient when we have been taking our time in terms of figuring out what it is we would like to have from their extensive menu. In my mind, Trade has been a very welcome addition to the neighbourhood indeed. Five stars.

kSKVolcWC1EsT4ueNQeUjg.text: The Reuben sandwich here is definitely in my top 5 sandwiches in London. They make their own pastrami in house and it's served in lovely toasted rye bread with sauerkraut and Swiss cheese with a pickle on the side. The taste is perfectly balanced and it's so juicy. The salads and quiches here are also great. I haven't tried the breakfasts yet but they look amazing, especially the avocado on sourdough. The coffee and cakes are also really good. The setting is nice despite being on a busy road - the tables are all out at the back with a glass back wall that opens out to a little courtyard. Also good for takeaway.

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Reuben

FwI9wvjqX7sHPJHmhpDYvQ.text: Great brunch options. Can have a wait but it usually goes really fast. The chili chorizo eggs was REALLY delicious, but spicy, so you have to be able to handle the heat. Excellent lattes as wrll

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom

dg7kQqkrPlcPDqLI5G6A6w.text: Had to wait a long time for the table, but once we got there, and got our food, it was delicious! The desserts are sooo good and the eggs were the best I've ever had.

bDDAudHQT6gpv9_SgOMghA.text: Brilliant brilliant brilliant. Key things:- Lovely "space" with both indoor and outdoor seating out the back- Great coffee where they "know what they're doing" coffee wise- Chorizo offered with the egg dishes. Yum.- They have their own smokery!- There's an Aussie vibe about the place (as in - the outstanding and creative Aussie brekkies you get in various spots around Oz)I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Nice interior - warm, classy
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Great menu
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Lovely Outdoor area

kGHU8H0WLYbj1cQFPohajA.text: OK fine, I can justify 4 stars no longer.Hi, my name is Sheera and I'm a smashed avo addict.Trade is perfection. It's cozy. Offers free wifi. Has outdoor seating. Is not teeming with pretentiousness. The flat whites make my heart go pitter patter and I regularly have vivid dreams about the smashed avocado with feta and poached eggs on toast.My one complaints is that something about the table varnish and their cleaning products don't mix and the effect is kind of sticky. Sticky like you need some effort to unstick your plate from the table but not the kind of sticky that's going to rub off on your hands or laptop or whatever. They should fix that. Doesn't matter... 6 stars for the smashed avo and minus one for sticky tables.

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Trade always has such beautiful looking pastries and treats
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Trade treats
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Trade treats

X012D0Zt69N8_3BhrIrvKw.text: Came back twice we liked it so much. Wait staff very friendly food was delicious I've never tasted such fresh eggs thank you

0YPcUqVP8Ejx5XTxg-3DaA.text: This place is great for a brunch on weekends. The food is simple but tasty and pretty cheap, and then the desert are amazing. The wait can be a bit long as this place is becoming more famous now. Only the service could be better as it is irregular; sometimes the waiters are really charming and sometimes you have to go take water by yourself.

JvHIbFYWUblrSXVK_XUu4Q.text: We walked relatively far to go to this place, and it was worth it. The food is so good, it's hard to believe its from a cafe setting. The coffee was great, every one was massively pleased with their food-- and i had picky eaters surrounding me at the time. I couldn't get over the gorgeous color of the egg yolks. Probably because our American eggs are overly pasteurized, but it just added to the incredible freshness of the food. Will absolutely return.

G2Jh05jJA71ZJgldrJYchA.text: Ended up here by accident, will definitely be going back again on purpose! It was such a sweet, authentic seeming place, not at all pretentious, run by lovely people. Food was so good, recommend the pancakes - so thick and fluffy. Good service and good portions. The cakes looked amazing. I was just way too full to try them. Will be next time!

2VYalzOlCo1qbZI8awMMBw.text: For a change of pace and if graving some Maine Lobster. Really nice garden space not expected from the front view. The deserts are sinful!The coffee was very decent so next time heading in to sample their breakfast

EyvWnOty5SwjvgBL-NGS6Q.text: To paraphrase the example yelp review; there are few times in life when a meal is so perfectly prepared with such a perfect combination of tastes that one is left in awe. The Reuben sandwich at Trade is one of those times. I can't speak for anything else, but all the cakes, salads, coffees...  Mmm. It all looks brilliant, and if the Reuben is anything to go by it will taste marvellous too. Do come, do. Have the Reuben. Have it a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. I don't know what you're doing right now, but stop it immediately & come to Trade for a Reuben sandwich.

aM5TpoD2Pp4t2E6NDvb-Sw.text: First class coffee, accompanied by a range of amazing brunch/breakfast options- starting from the organic scrambled eggs, going through the fluffy blueberry American pancakes and reaching the freshly made cakes. Perfect spot to spend your Saturday morning or Sunday afternoon

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Poached eggs on sourdough bread & blueberry pancakes with maple syrup

8GTX-5bIeASqnHdoamkyUw.text: So cute!Visiting from the US, I wandered into Trade allured by their "Secret Garden" sign. I enjoyed a latte in the garden in the back, and it was wonderful. Great ambiance. Friendly staff. Delicious drinks. I wish I would've discovered it sooner!

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Latte in the secret garden

mAVDRDDcHcCNvZoQOaaC2w.text: This is a fantastic place to come for Brunch or lunch. All the food I've had is always really homely and indulgent. Their cakes, sandwiches and snacks are great too. It's just a shame they're not open in the evening.I recommend the chilli jam cheese toastie.

XWln8sIXLJwTLQYQGSWsLQ.text: I was traveling alone in London and decide to take a walk to find breakfast. I fortunately found my way into Trade and ordered an Americano and a smashed chili lime avo with eggs. Since I'm from the Southwestern US, I was expecting the dish to not live up to my high standards when it comes to these types of dishes. However it was awesome! They even had Sriracha - bonus! The coffee was also quality and the service was very friendly. The seating area was nice and open with a patio out back to boot. Five stars!

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Smashed avo with chili and lime and scrambled eggs.

TngVSjXV1Fj0_bxGDeRfew.text: Stopped by for breakfast before our day trip to Stonehenge! Enjoyed how trendy it was. It's kind of a tight squeeze and a little cramped if you need to move between tables - I was worried about knocking someone's food over eep.What we ordered:Flat and hot tea - Love the cute design on the flat white and the big cups both drinks were served in. Tasty caffiene lol the flat white was super smooth.Corned beef eggs benedict - rich, I don't think it was memorable, but it wasn't badAvocado toast - standard avo toastNothing about the food wowed me, but I enjoyed the ambiance. Service was good. Cute little place to stop by before taking on the day!

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Avo Toast
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Pastrami Benedict
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Flat white and English tea to start the day

jAKpFNs5lR14xdHiPI8Dxw.text: Fantastic brunch options and terrific coffee.  It can be loud and the tables are close together, but service is friendly and everything we had was great!  I highly recommend the generously-sized grilled cheese - perfect hangover recovery food.

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. massive grilled cheese!

LWbx-liPePaTlmPK9FnX2w.text: The wait was a bit long during brunch hours -- about 25 minutes but Trade redeemed itself a bit when one of the servers offered everyone waiting in line a bit of carrot cake to help them pass the time. The décor was industrial hipster and quite well coordinated. However, due to them trying to accommodate as many patrons as possible, there were too many tables in too small of a space, leading to a slight feeling of claustrophobia. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with apple cider sauce. It was okay, the pork was a bit too tough and dry for my liking. The dishes such as the benedict options and the pastry cakes at the other tables seemed quite good though, so I would come back despite the mediocre pulled pork sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Pulled pork sandwich with apple cider dressing
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Impressive cake selection

XxdfXvZmOJUOdgiHwv4o9g.text: Came to Trade on the last day of visiting London for brunch before we headed for the train. It was nearby our hotel and had great reviews on Yelp. The way it works is that you order first and then they give you a spoon with a number on it and you sit down and the food is served to you. My husband and I ordered the chicken, bacon avocado club and pancakes with scrambled eggs. Both were very good. The staff there is friendly too. Good spot for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with eggs
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Chicken, bacon avocado club sandwich
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Bottle water

d2II43NDuSGKIjhsWWZfeQ.text: Saw a recommendation for Trade! on YouTube and brought my teenagers. Loved it. Incredibly affordable great food.

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Great, affordable breakfast at Trade.

SkcXkwYh1KmOfox1zttSXA.text: My new favourite cafe, been there twice now for brunch and for cake & coffee and will be back next week :). Warm and welcoming entrance, you are greeted by counter full of 'tradermade' cakes and slices. Staff are friendly and helpful. When I was there for Brunch as patron had a seizer and they team were quick to act. For Brunch I had asparagus, prosciutto and eggs. Different and tasty.Table next to me had a burger, looked good. Will be having that next time :D

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Eggs, prosciutto and asparagus
Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Coffee and cake

rnPixBvcqQm-_vqStCiRuw.text: Easy to see why this cafe has won many awards! The breakfast and lunch selection is fresh and full of natural colour although staff are often kept very busy and in the many times I have visited we are often held waiting just to pay the bill.I think I have been through the menu here, from the pancake with blueberry compote (£3.50 for a compote on the side can't be right?!) to the satisfyingly large sandwiches. The gentlemen at the front of house are great and it's clear to see they love what they do and get energised from being around customers (The bandana wearing dude is super welcoming!).Although generally quite good value for money, some items are a little overpriced in my opinion when looking at what you are paying for. However, the staff are generally friendly and there is often a queue out the door, they are doing something right!

ah9XN-exbPQolTShHhAJkA.text: Discovered this hidden gem for breakfast. Very friendly staff and delicious food! My grandmother and I shared a yummy mix of three salads with beans, mushrooms, tomato, feta cheese, string beans, onions and more. She had an open faces chorizo, egg and sausage sandwich with a latte. I had a mushroom and pesto grilled cheese sandwich with pink grapefruit juice. So delish!

qrwyuLNafrvlz5rXuEdL7w.text: I visited Trade at about 3pm on a Saturday. It was almost full but I was able to be seated right away. The tables are super close together so the place looks full and busy and it's easy to hear the nearby conversations. The entire menu looked yum. My grilled cheese with tomato relish was divine and so big I couldn't finish it. The service was a little inattentive which is why I won't give five stars - I and several others had to flag down the waiters or go up to the counter. Nonetheless I look forward to returning and trying more of the menu.

Lw4t2_2EHotkXupJ0e-HmQ.text: I have been looking for a sandwich place near the office and my search is over.  Trade is simply wonderful, but I would only recommend it if you are starved.  I got a Gruber which is a pile of Turkey and pastrami on a soft brioche bun, with a spicy sauce and pickles.  Lord in heaven, it was fantastic.   I can't wait to go back and try everything else.

DdtmyjgCiX1c7WQhP3UiLw.text: Dropped in on this place in Aug. while on my little vacation in London. Saw someone's post on Instagram and knew i had to find this place while in London. Me and a friend dropped by close to noon on a Monday and surprisingly there was a lot of people. The outdoor seating looked so comfortable but sadly all seats were taken, but we found a cozy table near a corner. Service was quick and proper. I got the avo smash toast with both the bacon and grilled chorizo and every bite was soooooooo good. Meanwhile my friend got the pastrami benedict. The toasted cholla roll looked pretty greased up but i bet it was worth it. The girl at the cashier was super friendly and cheeky, sadly i didn't get her name but she should get a trophy for being a bomb worker. Regardless both me and my friend left with a happy stomach.

qlY7M4ASL6Z6YbBCrrkj0w.text: Lovely place for great coffee and a tasty breakfast. Don't miss the patio at the rear.

6li9-M-poWofyOS8xkyoSQ.text: Great coffee great food wifi was perfect as well! I enjoyed the environment and the employees were very polite. I'm happy I went.

EZPwQHwqpQnvXUlTD5xBbw.text: Very nice service. I paid at the front for a flat white and sat at a corner table.  A server brought me my coffee as well as sugar. The typical independent coffee shop. Great ambience and soft lighting, with jazzy spunky music in the background. The food looked good too. My coffee was good. Lovely place.

TblTlJJyQukjl-d56vXv-g.text: Came here for brunch. This is basically a large coffee shop serving up brunch items that include some pretty amazing looking pancakes dressed in a variety of toppings (you've got your choice of chocolate chip, fruit compote, eggs and bacon, etc).Service was extremely slow for a restaurant that was barely at 50% capacity, so be prepared to proactively ask for everything you need. The patio is small, but a great place to dine when the weather is nice. Being on a (short-lived) health kick, I had the smashed avocado entree, which came with chorizo and poached eggs on sourdough. Delicious, but of the quality you could probably make at home. I could still taste the vinegar on the poached eggs, although the consistency of the insides were nice and runny.Also had the detox "smoothie", which was basically a green juice. Yummy, made me feel healthy.You pay for your meal at the register, which is a blessing when you're in a rush. The display at the register includes an array of amazing looking cakes and pastries. Tempting...why is being healthy so damn hard?!

3t078C2-652FZefPHewEIQ.text: WHAT, I live so close, cant believe Ive never been here for the last 8 months! I have definitely been missing out. As an avid grilled cheese fan, Trade definitely got me at chorizo AND egg toastie. Be warned though, that combination is definitely a little oily. They also have smashed avocado on sourdough bread and pancakes - just the way to my heart.The cafe wasnt very busy for sat brunch, they definitely have a good amount of seating in the back. Dont let the narrow entrance fool you. They also have patio area if you want to get some vitamin D. I will definitely be coming back here more regularly!

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom

Jv4q9wx9kHvP5rCx-sNheg.text: Amazing cafe! It's going to be my regular now. Friendly and quick service, delicious all day breakfast, gourmet sandwiches, and cakes.

photos.caption: Photo of TRADE - Commercial Street - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with blueberries and maple syrup.

mOl8MSqbLhejQRqP7hmuWQ.text: Kind of a prospective review, but all signs point to greatness.I stopped in at Trade real quick to grab an iced coffee, and had no idea it had the whole back seating area and garden.  It looks super cute, the iced coffee was very good, the staff were friendly and lively, and the food looked and smelled delicious.  Will definitely have to come back to try out a full meal, but in the meantime, I can add it to my "recommended" list for good East London coffee.

NWnoW0nTxLnGjSb9fMrCxQ.text: Came here straight from Liverpool St Station with tons of bags and were welcomed right away and seated even though it was very busy. The food is delicious as well as the beverages with large portions for a great price (especially in London). Would recommend eggs on toast, with literally anything. We did see a waffle though that we want to go back for. All in all this is a great way to start your day in London.
